meanings.definition: A type of ancient dwelling built on artificial islands in lakes or marshy areas.
meanings.sent1: The crannogs provided shelter for the ancient people.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologists discovered the remains of crannogs in the lake.
meanings.sent3: The ducks seemed to enjoy swimming around the crannogs.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination turned the crannogs into magical floating castles.
meanings.sent5: The crannogs stood proudly amidst the calm waters of the lake.

meanings.definition: The practice of constructing crannogs for shelter and defense.
meanings.sent2: The community relied on the crannogs for protection.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to build miniature crannogs out of sticks.
meanings.sent4: Their unity was their strongest crannog against adversity.
meanings.sent5: The crannogs symbolized safety and resilience in the ancient times.

meanings.definition: To study the history and archaeology of crannogs.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys researching and writing about crannogs.
meanings.sent2: They decided to crannog the ancient sites to learn more.
meanings.sent3: He crannogs every detail of the artifacts found near the lake.
meanings.sent4: The team plans to crannog the mysteries of the sunken crannogs.
meanings.sent5: Crannogging the past helps us understand our ancestors' lives better.
